conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted which container (D, E, or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid from A flows downward and passes through the orange baffle.
Liquid from A continues downward and aligns with the path towards container D.
Liquid from B flows downward and passes through the teal baffle.
Liquid from B continues downward and aligns with the path towards container E.
Liquid from C flows downward initially but slightly angled and passes through the pink baffle.
Liquid from C continues downward but slightly angled and aligns with the path towards container F.
Liquid from A flows into container D.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
